title: attachments on some emails not indicated
content: I'm using Firefox 102. Some emails (seems to be only one sender) do not indicate there is an attachment (and there isn't) but when viewed on webmail the PDF attachment is there and opens fine. The email source data indicates an attachment is somewhere. If the same email is forwarded from my phone the attachment is indicated to be there and is viewable OK. An email with a PDF attachment, from a completely different source a few days earlier had no problems and this issue seems to have been there for at least 2 years. Attached are two screenshots of the bottom of the faulty emails and the good email showing the attachment pane, it's there on the good email but not on the faulty one. There doesn't seem to be any way of turning the attachment pane off if there is an attachment there. There is also an image of the Firefox email list that indicates an attachment on the good forwarded email but missing on the faulty one.
creator: AlnDav

title: Home screen
content: I use to have the bookmarks show up on the left side of the screen at all times when I opened Firefox. Now, for some reason, I have to go to the bookmarks in the help area to find what I am looking for. How do I have the sorted bookmarks show up on the left again?
creator: rwheller2

title: playing videos on YouTube makes the screen black
content: My screen goes black while playing YouTube videos on Firefox. It plays ok on Microsoft edge
creator: njsteelcontracting
